The Tolkien and Cowling families remained friends; in [[1938]] they stayed with J.R.R. and [[Edith Tolkien|Edith]] at [[Oxford]] when on sabbatical leave.<ref name=Bay/>

column1: His wife Muriel (Mollie) maintained contact with the Tolkien family after her husband's death
column2: and visited the Tolkiens in [[England]] on several occasions. During such a visit in [[1955]]
column3: Muriel was given signed copies of three volumes of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' (in which Tolkien included a [[Tengwar]] inscription).<ref name=Bay/>
